metadata.command:
git commit -m "Phase 2: User authentication complete

✅ User Entity Migration:
- Created User entity with PHP 8.3 attributes (Doctrine ORM 3)
- Implements UserInterface + PasswordAuthenticatedUserInterface
- Roles stored as JSON array (Symfony 7 best practice)
- Removed salt (modern password hashers use bcrypt)
- Type-safe properties with strict types
- Created/Updated timestamps with lifecycle callbacks

✅ Security Configuration:
- Configured security.yaml with bcrypt password hasher
- Form login with CSRF protection
- Remember me functionality
- User switch for admin impersonation
- Role hierarchy (ROLE_ADMIN inherits ROLE_USER)
- Access control rules for /admin routes

✅ Controllers & Templates:
- SecurityController: login/logout routes
- AdminController: dashboard route (#[IsGranted('ROLE_USER')])
- Login template with Bootstrap styling
- Dashboard template with user info and navigation

✅ Repository:
- UserRepository with PasswordUpgraderInterface
- Custom query methods (findByUsername, findByEmail, findByRole)
- Pagination and search functionality
- Count methods for admin and active users

✅ Database Migration:
- Generated Version20251111104202 migration
- Created resymf_users table with proper constraints
- Executed migration successfully
- Schema validated and in sync

✅ Fixtures:
- Installed doctrine/doctrine-fixtures-bundle
- Created UserFixtures with 3 test users:
  * admin (admin@resymf.local) - ROLE_ADMIN
  * testuser (user@resymf.local) - ROLE_USER
  * inactive (inactive@resymf.local) - ROLE_USER [disabled]
- Password hashing integrated

✅ Verification:
- Database created successfully
- Migration executed (30.5ms, 2 SQL queries)
- Fixtures loaded (3 users created)
- Login page accessible (HTTP 200)
- Schema validation: all in sync

Phase 2 Progress: 75% (6/8 tasks complete)
Next: Create Settings entity, then functional tests
"
